funder.name: Agentúra na Podporu Výskumu a Vývoja

abstract: <jats:p><jats:italic>Ancyronyx clisteri</jats:italic><jats:bold>sp. nov.</jats:bold>(Coleoptera, Elmidae) a new spider riffle beetle discovered from northern Borneo (Brunei; Sabah and Sarawak, Malaysia) and the larva of<jats:italic>Ancyronyx sarawacensis</jats:italic>Jäch are described. Illustrations of the habitus and diagnostic characters of the new species and the similar and highly variable<jats:italic>A. sarawacensis</jats:italic>are presented. Differences to closely related species, based on DNA barcodes and morphological characters, are discussed. Association of the larva and the imago of<jats:italic>A. sarawacensis</jats:italic>, and the occurrence of<jats:italic>Ancyronyx procerus</jats:italic>Jäch in Peninsular Malaysia and Sabah are confirmed by using COI mtDNA sequences.</jats:p>
title: Ancyronyx clisteri, a new spider riffle beetle species from Borneo, redescription of A. sarawacensis Jäch including a description of the larva and new distribution data for A. procerus Jäch using DNA barcodes (Coleoptera, Elmidae)
